**DONT INCLUDE DASHES IN VARIABLE NAME**

= IFS =

IFS is an environment variable that bash uses as word/item boundaries when processing character strings

== Example 1==
{{{bash
string="first second:third forth:fifth"

for item in $string; do
    echo "$item"
done
}}}

*Output*:
{{{
first
second:third
forth:fifth
}}}


== Example 2 ==

{{{bash
***REMOVED*** Set the IFS to collon (:) character
IFS=:

string="first second:third forth:fifth"

for item in $string; do
    echo "$item"
done
}}}

*Output*:
{{{
first second  
third forth  
fifth
}}}
